duties_responsibilities.duty: Document pertinent nursing notes to reflect change in condition, transfer, and discharge.
Administer medications in accordance with physician orders.
Respond to and refer incoming telephone calls, including phone triage when needed.
Responsible for efficient throughput and understanding of all care zones such as triage, rapid treatment area, carepath, pediatric ER, trauma, behavioral health, etc.
Coordinate and triage incoming ambulance traffic.
Manage care with primary ER attending.
Responsible for learning, understanding, and use of the Emergency Severity Index 5-level triage algorithm.
Respond to critical needs and serve as a resource nurse for trauma.
Educate patients regarding medications, procedures, and treatments, providing support throughout their stay.

education_certification.credential: Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the State of Georgia, multistate, or able to obtain licensure prior to start is required.
Associate Degree, or Registered Nurse Diploma.
1+ years experience as RN in acute care environment is preferred.
Current American Heart Association (AHA) or American Red Cross Basic Life Support (BLS) Health Care Provider is required.
Current American Heart Association (AHA) or American Red Cross Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) is preferred and required to be obtained within 12 months of hire/transfer date.
Current American Heart Association (AHA) or American Red Cross Pediatric Life Support (PALS) is preferred and required to be obtained within 12 months of hire/transfer date.
Previous emergency, pre-hospital, or critical care Registered Nurse experience preferred.
